body.p:
The oxy_htmlContent built-in form control is used for rendering HTML content. This HTML content is displayed as a graphical element shaped as a box. The shape of the box is determined by a given width and the height is computed based upon the length of the text. This type of form control supports the following properties:
The resource needs to be a well-formed HTML file.
This is a div element that has a unique id and is a child of the body element. The div element is the container of the HTML content to be rendered by the form control.

You can customize the style of the content using CSS that is either referred by the file identified by the href property or is defined in-line. If you change the HTML content or CSS and you want your changes to be reflected in the XML that renders the form control, then you need to refresh the XML file. If the HTML does not have an associated style, then a default text and background color will be applied.

example.p: In the following example, the form control collects the content from the p_description div element found in the descriptions.html file. The box is 400 pixels wide and is displayed before a paragraph identified by the intro_id attribute value.p#intro_id:before { content: oxy_htmlContent( href, "descriptions.html", id, "p_description", width, 400px); }

body.note: Anchor HTML elements are displayed but the links are inactive.

You can use the Content Completion Assistant in the CSS editor to easily insert a sample of the form control by selecting the corresponding code template. The code templates are displayed with a symbol in the content complete list.
To insert a sample of the oxy_htmlContent form control, invoke the Content Completion Assistant by pressing and select the oxy_htmlContent code template.
